subject: Re: Parameterized test does not play well with Eclipse TestRunner UI
msgSnippet: ... Token taken. I will report the bug and post URL when done (expect monday). cheers, AA
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Tim Diggins <subscribed@...> wrote:
>
>
> On 17 Sep 2008, at 14:24, David Saff wrote:
>
> > On Fri, Sep 12, 2008 at 12:39 PM, adrian.kuhn
> > <adrian.kuhn@...> wrote:
> >> This is a JUnit issue as well. I have the same issue with JExample:
> >> if a
> >> test has parameters, you can rerun a single test, but not browse it.
> >>
> >> Why does this happen? The plugin works with the
> >> org.junit.runner.Description
> >> that it gets from JUnit. Such a description contains a mere string
> >> rather
> >> than a reference to a java method, thus the plugin must guess about
> >> the
> >> strings format when trying to locate the method for browsing.
> >
> > Can you (or an interested observer) open a bug against Eclipse for
> > this? Custom runners can of course make the descriptions whatever
> > they want (the test may not refer to any Java method at all), but it
> > seems that methodName[OTHER_INFORMATION] is a reasonable template that
> > Eclipse should respect.
> >
> > Thanks!
> >
> > David
> >
>
> I think I understand this slightly less than adrian, so best if he can
> open the bug... but will do so if he does not...
> First person to open the bug please post back here the url for it!
>

Token taken. I will report the bug and post URL when done (expect monday).

cheers,
AA
